places.name: The Torres del Paine (The Towers) - Peaks
places.description: Three massive granite spires rising dramatically above a turquoise glacial lake — the park's most famous landmark.

places.name: Cuernos del Paine (The Horns) - Peaks
places.description: Striking multi-colored horn-shaped peaks with dark sedimentary layers contrasting sharply against grey granite.

places.name: Lago / Lake Pehoé
places.description: One of the most photogenic lakes in Patagonia, with turquoise waters and stunning reflections of surrounding peaks, including the Cuernos.

places.name: Lago / Lake Nordenskjöld
places.description: A large, scenic lake with milky turquoise waters located at the base of the Cuernos del Paine — perfect for photography and moderate hikes.

places.name: Grey Glacier / Glaciar
places.description: A massive glacier part of the Southern Patagonian Ice Field. Accessible by boat or ice trekking tours.

places.name: French Glacier / Glaciar
places.description: A hanging glacier in the French Valley, constantly cracking and calving — often heard before it’s seen.

Valleys & Viewpoints.name: Valle del Francés (French Valley)
Valleys & Viewpoints.description: A central section of the W Trek, featuring hanging glaciers and epic cliff walls.

Valleys & Viewpoints.name: Valle del Silencio (Silence Valley)
Valleys & Viewpoints.description: A remote and quiet valley on the O Circuit, surrounded by rugged terrain.

Wildlife & Scenic Zones.name: Laguna Amarga / Lagoon
Wildlife & Scenic Zones.description: A lake with high mineral content and common sightings of flamingos and guanacos — a main park entry point.

Wildlife & Scenic Zones.name: Sierra Masle Lookout / Mirador
Wildlife & Scenic Zones.description: A quiet, lesser-known ridge with panoramic views over Lago Sarmiento and the open Patagonian steppe.
